smp 3.1.1
built with pdoc

smp.os_management

The Simple Management Protocol (SMP) OS Management group.

  1"""The Simple Management Protocol (SMP) OS Management group."""
  2
  3from __future__ import annotations
  4
  5from enum import IntEnum, unique
  6from typing import Any, Dict, Literal
  7
  8from pydantic import BaseModel, ConfigDict, Field
  9
 10from smp import error, header, message
 11
 12
 13class EchoWriteRequest(message.WriteRequest):
 14    """Echo back the provided string."""
 15
 16    _GROUP_ID = header.GroupId.OS_MANAGEMENT
 17    _COMMAND_ID = header.CommandId.OSManagement.ECHO
 18
 19    d: str
 20    """String to echo."""
 21
 22
 23class EchoWriteResponse(message.WriteResponse):
 24    """Success response to an echo request."""
 25
 26    _GROUP_ID = header.GroupId.OS_MANAGEMENT
 27    _COMMAND_ID = header.CommandId.OSManagement.ECHO
 28
 29    r: str
 30    """Echoed string."""
 31
 32
 33class ResetWriteRequest(message.WriteRequest):
 34    """Performs reset of system.
 35
 36    The device should issue response before resetting so that the SMP client
 37    could receive information that the command has been accepted. By default,
 38    this command is accepted in all conditions, however if the
 39    `CONFIG_MCUMGR_GRP_OS_RESET_HOOK` is enabled and an application registers a
 40    callback, the callback will be called when this command is issued and can be
 41    used to perform any necessary tidy operations prior to the module rebooting,
 42    or to reject the reset request outright altogether with an error response.
 43
 44    For details on this functionality, see [callbacks](https://docs.zephyrproject.org/latest/services/device_mgmt/mcumgr_callbacks.html#mcumgr-callbacks).  # noqa: E501
 45    """
 46
 47    _GROUP_ID = header.GroupId.OS_MANAGEMENT
 48    _COMMAND_ID = header.CommandId.OSManagement.RESET
 49
 50    force: Literal[0, 1] | None = None
 51    """Force reset.
 52
 53    Normally the command sends an empty CBOR map as data, but if a previous
 54    reset attempt has responded with rc equal to MGMT_ERR_EBUSY then the
 55    following map may be sent to force a reset
 56    """
 57
 58
 59class ResetWriteResponse(message.WriteResponse):
 60    """Success response to a reset request."""
 61
 62    _GROUP_ID = header.GroupId.OS_MANAGEMENT
 63    _COMMAND_ID = header.CommandId.OSManagement.RESET
 64
 65
 66class TaskStatisticsReadRequest(message.ReadRequest):
 67    """Request task statistics."""
 68
 69    _GROUP_ID = header.GroupId.OS_MANAGEMENT
 70    _COMMAND_ID = header.CommandId.OSManagement.TASK_STATS
 71
 72
 73class TaskStatistics(BaseModel):
 74    """Task statistics."""
 75
 76    model_config = ConfigDict(extra="forbid", frozen=True)
 77
 78    prio: int
 79    """Task priority."""
 80    tid: int
 81    """Numeric task ID."""
 82    state: int
 83    """Numeric task state."""
 84    stkuse: int
 85    """Stack usage.
 86
 87    The unit is system dependent and in case of Zephyr this is number of 4 byte words.
 88    """
 89    stksize: int
 90    """Stack size.
 91
 92    The unit is system dependent and in case of Zephyr this is number of 4 byte words.
 93    """
 94    cswcnt: int
 95    """Number of context switches."""
 96    runtime: int
 97    """Runtime in ticks."""
 98    last_checkin: int
 99    """Set to 0 by Zephyr."""
100    next_checkin: int
101    """Set to 0 by Zephyr."""
102
103
104class TaskStatisticsReadResponse(message.ReadResponse):
105    """Task statistics response."""
106
107    _GROUP_ID = header.GroupId.OS_MANAGEMENT
108    _COMMAND_ID = header.CommandId.OSManagement.TASK_STATS
109
110    tasks: Dict[str, TaskStatistics]
111    """Task statistics map."""
112

114class MemoryPoolStatisticsReadRequest(message.ReadRequest):

117    _GROUP_ID = header.GroupId.OS_MANAGEMENT
118    _COMMAND_ID = header.CommandId.OSManagement.MEMORY_POOL_STATS
119
120
121class MemoryPoolStatistics(BaseModel):
122    """Memory pool statistics."""
123
124    model_config = ConfigDict(extra="forbid", frozen=True)
125
126    blksize: int
127    """Size of the memory block in the pool."""
128    nblks: int
129    """Number of memory blocks in the pool."""
130    nfree: int
131    """Number of free memory blocks in the pool."""
132    min: int
133    """Lowest number of free blocks the pool reached during run-time."""
134

184class MCUMgrParametersReadResponse(message.ReadResponse):
185    """Success response to a MCU Manager parameters request."""
186
187    _GROUP_ID = header.GroupId.OS_MANAGEMENT
188    _COMMAND_ID = header.CommandId.OSManagement.MCUMGR_PARAMETERS

195
196class OSApplicationInfoReadRequest(message.ReadRequest):
197    """Request information about the application running on the device."""
198
199    _GROUP_ID = header.GroupId.OS_MANAGEMENT
200    _COMMAND_ID = header.CommandId.OSManagement.OS_APPLICATION_INFO
201
202    format: str | None = None
203    """Format specifier of returned response.
204
205    Fields are appended in their natural ascending index order, not the order
206    of characters that are received by the command.
207
208    Format specifiers:
209    * `s` Kernel name
210    * `n` Node name
211    * `r` Kernel release
212    * `v` Kernel version
213    * `b` Build date and time (requires `CONFIG_MCUMGR_GRP_OS_INFO_BUILD_DATE_TIME`)
214    * `m` Machine
215    * `p` Processor
216    * `i` Hardware platform
217    * `o` Operating system
218    * `a` All fields (shorthand for all above options)
219
220    If this option is not provided, the `s` Kernel name option will be used.
221    """
222
223
224class OSApplicationInfoReadResponse(message.ReadResponse):
225    """Success response to an application information request."""
226
227    _GROUP_ID = header.GroupId.OS_MANAGEMENT
228    _COMMAND_ID = header.CommandId.OSManagement.OS_APPLICATION_INFO
229
230    output: str
231    """Text response including requested parameters."""
232
233
234class BootloaderInformationReadRequest(message.ReadRequest):
235    """Request bootloader information."""
236
237    _GROUP_ID = header.GroupId.OS_MANAGEMENT
238    _COMMAND_ID = header.CommandId.OSManagement.BOOTLOADER_INFO
239
240    query: str | None = None
241    """Is string representing query for parameters.
242
243    With no restrictions how the query looks like as processing of query is left
244    for bootloader backend. If there is no query, then response will return string
245    identifying the bootloader.
246
247    MCUboot supports the query string,"mode".  The response to mode is of type
248    `MCUbootMode`.
249    """
250
251
252@unique
253class MCUbootMode(IntEnum):
254    UNKNOWN = -1
255    APPLICATION = 0
256    SWAP_USING_SCRATCH = 1
257    OVERWRITE_ONLY = 2
258    SWAP_WITHOUT_SCRATCH = 3
259    DIRECT_XIP_WITHOUT_REVERT = 4
260    DIRECT_XIP_WITH_REVERT = 5
261    RAM_LOADER = 6
262
263
264class MCUbootModeQueryResponse(BaseModel):
265    """Response to a MCUboot mode query."""
266
267    model_config = ConfigDict(extra="forbid", frozen=True)
268
269    mode: MCUbootMode
270    no_downgrade: bool | None = Field(alias="no-downgrade", default=None)
271
272
273class BootloaderInformationReadResponse(message.ReadResponse):
274    """Success response to a bootloader information request."""
275
276    _GROUP_ID = header.GroupId.OS_MANAGEMENT
277    _COMMAND_ID = header.CommandId.OSManagement.BOOTLOADER_INFO
278
279    bootloader: str
280    """String identifying the bootloader.  For MCUboot it will be "MCUboot"."""
281    response: MCUbootModeQueryResponse | Any | None = None
282    """Response to query.
283
284    This is optional and may be left out in case when query yields no response,
285    SMP version 2 error code of `OS_MGMT_ERR_QUERY_YIELDS_NO_ANSWER` is
286    expected. Response may have more than one parameter reported back or it may
287    be a map, that is dependent on bootloader backend and query."""
288
289
290@unique
291class OS_MGMT_RET_RC(IntEnum):
292    """OS Management return codes."""
293
294    OK = 0
295    """No error, this is implied if there is no ret value in the response."""
296
297    UNKNOWN = 1
298    """Unknown error occurred."""
299
300    INVALID_FORMAT = 2
301    """The provided format value is not valid."""
302
303    QUERY_YIELDS_NO_ANSWER = 3
304    """Query was not recognized."""
305
306    RTC_NOT_SET = 4
307    """RTC is not set."""
308
309    RTC_COMMAND_FAILED = 5
310    """RTC command failed."""
311
312
313class OSManagementErrorV1(error.ErrorV1):
314    """OS Management error response."""
315
316    _GROUP_ID = header.GroupId.OS_MANAGEMENT
317
318
319class OSManagementErrorV2(error.ErrorV2[OS_MGMT_RET_RC]):
320    """OS Management error response."""
321
322    _GROUP_ID = header.GroupId.OS_MANAGEMENT

class ResetWriteRequest(smp.message.WriteRequest): 
34class ResetWriteRequest(message.WriteRequest):
35    """Performs reset of system.
36
37    The device should issue response before resetting so that the SMP client
38    could receive information that the command has been accepted. By default,
39    this command is accepted in all conditions, however if the
40    `CONFIG_MCUMGR_GRP_OS_RESET_HOOK` is enabled and an application registers a
41    callback, the callback will be called when this command is issued and can be
42    used to perform any necessary tidy operations prior to the module rebooting,
43    or to reject the reset request outright altogether with an error response.
44
45    For details on this functionality, see [callbacks](https://docs.zephyrproject.org/latest/services/device_mgmt/mcumgr_callbacks.html#mcumgr-callbacks).  # noqa: E501
46    """
47
48    _GROUP_ID = header.GroupId.OS_MANAGEMENT
49    _COMMAND_ID = header.CommandId.OSManagement.RESET
50
51    force: Literal[0, 1] | None = None
52    """Force reset.
53
54    Normally the command sends an empty CBOR map as data, but if a previous
55    reset attempt has responded with rc equal to MGMT_ERR_EBUSY then the
56    following map may be sent to force a reset
57    """

Performs reset of system.

The device should issue response before resetting so that the SMP client could receive information that the command has been accepted. By default, this command is accepted in all conditions, however if the CONFIG_MCUMGR_GRP_OS_RESET_HOOK is enabled and an application registers a callback, the callback will be called when this command is issued and can be used to perform any necessary tidy operations prior to the module rebooting, or to reject the reset request outright altogether with an error response.

For details on this functionality, see callbacks. # noqa: E501

force: Optional[Literal[0, 1]]

Force reset.

Normally the command sends an empty CBOR map as data, but if a previous reset attempt has responded with rc equal to MGMT_ERR_EBUSY then the following map may be sent to force a reset

class TaskStatistics(pydantic.main.BaseModel):

 86    """Stack usage.

 88    The unit is system dependent and in case of Zephyr this is number of 4 byte words.

state: int

Numeric task state.

stkuse: int

Stack size.

The unit is system dependent and in case of Zephyr this is number of 4 byte words.

cswcnt: int

Number of context switches.

runtime: int

Runtime in ticks.

last_checkin: int

Set to 0 by Zephyr.

next_checkin: int

Set to 0 by Zephyr.

class OSApplicationInfoReadRequest(smp.message.ReadRequest): 
197class OSApplicationInfoReadRequest(message.ReadRequest):
198    """Request information about the application running on the device."""
199
200    _GROUP_ID = header.GroupId.OS_MANAGEMENT
201    _COMMAND_ID = header.CommandId.OSManagement.OS_APPLICATION_INFO
202
203    format: str | None = None
204    """Format specifier of returned response.
205
206    Fields are appended in their natural ascending index order, not the order
207    of characters that are received by the command.
208
209    Format specifiers:
210    * `s` Kernel name
211    * `n` Node name
212    * `r` Kernel release
213    * `v` Kernel version
214    * `b` Build date and time (requires `CONFIG_MCUMGR_GRP_OS_INFO_BUILD_DATE_TIME`)
215    * `m` Machine
216    * `p` Processor
217    * `i` Hardware platform
218    * `o` Operating system
219    * `a` All fields (shorthand for all above options)
220
221    If this option is not provided, the `s` Kernel name option will be used.
222    """

Request information about the application running on the device.

format: str | None

Format specifier of returned response.

Fields are appended in their natural ascending index order, not the order of characters that are received by the command.

Format specifiers:

  • s Kernel name
  • n Node name
  • r Kernel release
  • v Kernel version
  • b Build date and time (requires CONFIG_MCUMGR_GRP_OS_INFO_BUILD_DATE_TIME)
  • m Machine
  • p Processor
  • i Hardware platform
  • o Operating system
  • a All fields (shorthand for all above options)

If this option is not provided, the s Kernel name option will be used.

class BootloaderInformationReadRequest(smp.message.ReadRequest): 
235class BootloaderInformationReadRequest(message.ReadRequest):
236    """Request bootloader information."""
237
238    _GROUP_ID = header.GroupId.OS_MANAGEMENT
239    _COMMAND_ID = header.CommandId.OSManagement.BOOTLOADER_INFO
240
241    query: str | None = None
242    """Is string representing query for parameters.
243
244    With no restrictions how the query looks like as processing of query is left
245    for bootloader backend. If there is no query, then response will return string
246    identifying the bootloader.
247
248    MCUboot supports the query string,"mode".  The response to mode is of type
249    `MCUbootMode`.
250    """

Request bootloader information.

query: str | None

Is string representing query for parameters.

With no restrictions how the query looks like as processing of query is left for bootloader backend. If there is no query, then response will return string identifying the bootloader.

MCUboot supports the query string,"mode". The response to mode is of type MCUbootMode.

class BootloaderInformationReadResponse(smp.message.ReadResponse): 
274class BootloaderInformationReadResponse(message.ReadResponse):
275    """Success response to a bootloader information request."""
276
277    _GROUP_ID = header.GroupId.OS_MANAGEMENT
278    _COMMAND_ID = header.CommandId.OSManagement.BOOTLOADER_INFO
279
280    bootloader: str
281    """String identifying the bootloader.  For MCUboot it will be "MCUboot"."""
282    response: MCUbootModeQueryResponse | Any | None = None
283    """Response to query.
284
285    This is optional and may be left out in case when query yields no response,
286    SMP version 2 error code of `OS_MGMT_ERR_QUERY_YIELDS_NO_ANSWER` is
287    expected. Response may have more than one parameter reported back or it may
288    be a map, that is dependent on bootloader backend and query."""

Success response to a bootloader information request.

bootloader: str

String identifying the bootloader. For MCUboot it will be "MCUboot".

response: MCUbootModeQueryResponse | typing.Any | None

Response to query.

This is optional and may be left out in case when query yields no response, SMP version 2 error code of OS_MGMT_ERR_QUERY_YIELDS_NO_ANSWER is expected. Response may have more than one parameter reported back or it may be a map, that is dependent on bootloader backend and query.

@unique
class OS_MGMT_RET_RC(enum.IntEnum): 
291@unique
292class OS_MGMT_RET_RC(IntEnum):
293    """OS Management return codes."""
294
295    OK = 0
296    """No error, this is implied if there is no ret value in the response."""
297
298    UNKNOWN = 1
299    """Unknown error occurred."""
300
301    INVALID_FORMAT = 2
302    """The provided format value is not valid."""
303
304    QUERY_YIELDS_NO_ANSWER = 3
305    """Query was not recognized."""
306
307    RTC_NOT_SET = 4
308    """RTC is not set."""
309
310    RTC_COMMAND_FAILED = 5
311    """RTC command failed."""

OS Management return codes.

OK = <OS_MGMT_RET_RC.OK: 0>

No error, this is implied if there is no ret value in the response.

UNKNOWN = <OS_MGMT_RET_RC.UNKNOWN: 1>

Unknown error occurred.

INVALID_FORMAT = <OS_MGMT_RET_RC.INVALID_FORMAT: 2>

The provided format value is not valid.

QUERY_YIELDS_NO_ANSWER = <OS_MGMT_RET_RC.QUERY_YIELDS_NO_ANSWER: 3>

Query was not recognized.

RTC_NOT_SET = <OS_MGMT_RET_RC.RTC_NOT_SET: 4>

RTC is not set.

RTC_COMMAND_FAILED = <OS_MGMT_RET_RC.RTC_COMMAND_FAILED: 5>

RTC command failed.
